properties.areaDesc: Cherokee, KS; Lawrence, MO; Jasper, MO; Dade, MO; Crawford, KS
properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 2 at 12:30AM CST until March 2 at 2:30AM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
At 1228 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy
rain across the warned area. Up to three inches of rain have already
fallen. Flash flooding is likely ongoing.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage
and low lying areas.

This warning includes but is not limited to the following low water
crossings...
North Main and Murphy Boulevard In Joplin...
Highway 97 at The Spring River north of Stotts City...
Highway 37 at The Spring River southwest of Avilla...
Route JJ at Center Creek southeast of Carl Junction...
and Route F, 3 miles northeast of Reeds.

Additional rainfall amounts of one to two inches are possible in
the warned area through 2 AM CST.
properties.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring.
If you are in the warned area move to higher ground immediately.
Residents living along streams and creeks should take immediate
precautions to protect life and property.

NWSheadline: THE FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM CST FOR NORTHERN CHEROKEE...SOUTHERN CRAWFORD...NORTHERN LAWRENCE...JASPER AND SOUTHERN DADE COUNTIES
